cause.description:
The Ecumenical Hunger Program (EHP), a 32 year old, private, non-profit, community-based organization located in East Palo Alto provides emergency food, clothing, case management, and household essentials to families in need in East Palo Alto, Menlo Park, and Palo Alto. In addition, EHP plays a major role in both advocating for, and providing referrals to resources available to low-income families and individuals in our community.
http://www.ehpcares.org
1. Compassion: Every person deserves and receives our caring and our empathy.
2. Respect: Each person brings unique strengths and gifts to EHP. All staff, volunteers, and clients are treated respectfully by one another.
3. Integrity: We are always honest, open and fair in our use of the resources entrusted to us.
4. Sustainability: We manage our assets so that we will be part of the community for as long as our services are needed. Similarly, we seek to help our clients make changes in their lives that sustain their families.
5. Empowerment: Each person – staff, volunteers and clients – does their best when they are given as much responsibility as possible to contribute ideas and make good choices.
6. Teamwork: Everyone is best served when we work together. Our differences help us find creative solutions to problems.
cause.mission: The mission of EHP is to provide food, clothing , household essentials, client support, and referral services to those in need.
